awd_abstract_narration:
This award is made as part of the FY 2019 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to James Farre is "Bounded Cohomology and Representations of Groups." The host institution for the fellowship is Yale University, and the sponsoring scientist is Yair Minksy.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The major goals of the project were to investigate moduli spaces of geometric structures on closed surfaces and three-manifolds.  Various aspects of the moduli spaces were considered: geometry of the moduli space, dynamics of certain flows or symmetry groups, and identifying loci of geometrical significance.  Overall, the project was successful, resulting in several novel results.  For example, in joint work with Aaron Calderon, we classified the earthquake and dilation flow invariant ergodic Borel probability measures on the bundle of unit length laminations over the moduli space of genus g Riemann surfaces.  This extended important results of Mirzakhani on the dynamics of the earthquake flow.  Additionally, with Or Landesberg and Yair Minsky, we classified the horocycle orbit closures in infinite cyclic covers of closed hyperbolic surfaces.  This constitutes a step forward in the classification of horocycle orbit closures on geometrically infinite hyperbolic surfaces with 2 or more ends. For representations of discrete groups into certain semi-simple lie groups, we showed that the bounded Borel class of representations with dense image are uniformly separated in semi-norm from the discrete and faithful representations.  Thus this invariant helps to identify geometrically meaningful representations.  With Franco Vargas Pallete, we showed that least area minimal surfaces in the class of the fiber of a fibration over the circle do not penetrate deeply into Margulis tubes;  this gave us some examples of minimal surfaces whose maximal principal curvatures were bounded below by a number strictly larger than 1, hence are somewhat far away from the closure of almost Fuchsian manifolds studied by Uhlenbeck.  

 


Last Modified: 09/29/2023
Modified by: James R Farre
por.por_txt_cntn:
The major goals of the project were to investigate moduli spaces of geometric structures on closed surfaces and three-manifolds.  Various aspects of the moduli spaces were considered: geometry of the moduli space, dynamics of certain flows or symmetry groups, and identifying loci of geometrical significance.  Overall, the project was successful, resulting in several novel results.  For example, in joint work with Aaron Calderon, we classified the earthquake and dilation flow invariant ergodic Borel probability measures on the bundle of unit length laminations over the moduli space of genus g Riemann surfaces.  This extended important results of Mirzakhani on the dynamics of the earthquake flow.  Additionally, with Or Landesberg and Yair Minsky, we classified the horocycle orbit closures in infinite cyclic covers of closed hyperbolic surfaces.  This constitutes a step forward in the classification of horocycle orbit closures on geometrically infinite hyperbolic surfaces with 2 or more ends. For representations of discrete groups into certain semi-simple lie groups, we showed that the bounded Borel class of representations with dense image are uniformly separated in semi-norm from the discrete and faithful representations.  Thus this invariant helps to identify geometrically meaningful representations.  With Franco Vargas Pallete, we showed that least area minimal surfaces in the class of the fiber of a fibration over the circle do not penetrate deeply into Margulis tubes;  this gave us some examples of minimal surfaces whose maximal principal curvatures were bounded below by a number strictly larger than 1, hence are somewhat far away from the closure of almost Fuchsian manifolds studied by Uhlenbeck.
